content.question: Directions: Read the following passage carefully. Ac veluti magno in populo cum saepe coorta est seditio saevitque animis ignobile vulgus, iamque faces et saxa volant, furor arma ministrat; tum, pietate gravem ac meritis si forte virum quem conspexere, silent arrectisque1 auribus astant. 1arrectus, -a, -um: pricked up Translate the passage above as literally as possible.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
